title: Kwesi Botchwey Optimistic About IMF Programme
text:
12 August 2015 16:42 CET Kwesi Botchwey Optimistic About IMF Programme By Daily Guide 
Dr Kwesi Botchwey, a former Finance Minister has indicated that Ghanaians will start realizing the full benefits of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) programme government signed onto soon. 
The country is yet to realize the expected benefits of the programme almost four months after the deal. 
Professor Kwesi Botchwey, who led the IMF negotiations, told journalists it will take some time for the actual impact of the programme to be felt in the country's economy. 
According to him, the fiscals were already taking shape, which will trickle down to other sectors of the economy soon. 
These assurances are coming despite criticism from some economists that the much- talked about inflow of investor funds and a stabilized Ghana cedi appears to be eluding the country. 
Prof Botchwey also denied reports that the country received just under $1billion dollars from IMF because it was not prepared for tougher conditions associated with the programme to stabilize the economy. 
Ghana received about $918 million spread over three years, but some analysts say the country could have secured about $1.5 billion under tougher conditions. 
But the professor said such reports are false.In a related development, the board of the IMF is set to meet next month to review Ghana's performance after staff carried out its first review. 
If the IMF board approves the staff report, it will pave the way for the release of some $114 million to support the country's balance of payment. 
Source: Myjoyonline.com
